How do Computer Picks Work?

Sports betting is difficult, but it can be easier with some proper help. Instead of tracking all the advanced analytics and data yourself, allow our computer model to return predictions for the final score of an upcoming game.

From that final score, we can predict things like the moneyline, spread, and total for each game. There is always a chance of the computer pick being wrong, but by using historical data that measures past matchups of teams with similar statistics, as well as taking things like injuries and weather into account, OddsTrader can improve your chance of victory over time.

The computer model allows for repeatable results in the future because this is a data-driven approach that takes the emotional side of betting out of the equation. Any sports bettor can twist themselves into taking the other side if they think about it hard enough.

Our computer picks are released as early as possible to give you the most time to bet, but it usually depends on when the betting lines are released at different online sportsbooks. Once lines are posted for an upcoming game, our predictions will be available. You can also identify which sportsbook has the best live numbers and odds for the pick you want to make.

Making The Best Bets Today

Using Computer Picks To Make Smart Bets

Frequent bettors may be able to pick up on certain trends on teams, but there are countless teams and factors to follow at once. It can be time-consuming to go over the data for the whole league in time for today’s games, and this is something you could have to do daily depending on which sport you are betting on. You also have to keep track of player injury reports that will impact the next game’s betting lines.

That is why using computer picks can be very useful. Our picks dramatically cut down your research time and crunch all the pertinent data to create predictions based on historical trends, how teams match up to one another, and the impact of injuries.

How often does a 3.5-point favorite with one of the best offenses in the league cover against a team with one of the best defenses? This is just one of the inputs the algorithm will use before creating a prediction based on data from similar matchups. Computer picks derived from good data should give you a better chance of victory than a random expert who may be too emotionally attached to their choice.

While no system is capable of getting things right all the time, the consistency from a data-driven approach produces more accurate picks than relying on anecdotal evidence.

Computer Picks & Sports Predictions FAQ

It’s normal to have questions about the sports betting process and how our computer picks factor into the equation. See some frequently asked questions and answers below. 

Are sports picks worth buying?

Serious bettors may consider paying for expert picks, but you must take caution in giving money to any online gambling service. Some have been guilty of fraudulent behavior and ripping off customers.

There are plenty of free research tools available online, so if you are serious about sports betting, you should be willing to put in the time to do your own research. With the computer picks generated by the OddsTrader BetStation, you can cut your research time down drastically and get reliable predictions at no cost.

How do you read bet picks?

For spread picks, the team with the negative number is the favorite and the team with the positive number is the underdog. The favorite has to win by at least as many points as the spread to win the bet. The underdog cannot lose by more than the spread to win the bet, and if they win the game outright, you also win.

For moneyline picks, you just pick the team you think will win the game, and the more negative their odds are, the higher the chance of victory is.

For total picks, you are just selecting the over or under for the total number of points scored in the game.

How do parlay picks work?

As opposed to a single bet that includes one event with a desired outcome, a parlay is a series of multiple bets on one slip. For the parlay to hit, you must get every leg right. If any leg ends with a push, then most sportsbooks will void that leg and you can win the rest of the parlay with the odds from the void leg removed.

Parlays are not easy to win, and while the addition of each leg will increase the amount you can win, it will always decrease your chance of victory.

Do computer picks work?

Yes, however, no system is perfect in sports betting. Random variance will always be an issue, but computer picks can consistently yield above-average results that are beneficial to the bettor. You should still factor in your own research before placing a bet, but computer picks are a good tool to utilize.

Which betting site has the best odds?

With a growing number of sportsbook options available to the public, you will find plenty of competitive odds across the various leagues and betting markets.
